access.notes: Obfuscated URL path (sldkjljieo0935jljsrnfkl) with noindex/nofollow. Canonical URL is https://www.nextgen.com/legal/sldkjljieo0935jljsrnfkl. Standard HTML page served by Sitecore CMS, no JavaScript rendering needed. PDF link visible directly on page.

export_format.description: Varies by product. NextGen Enterprise EHR: machine-readable database export (SQL Server tables) with images/documents in file folders. NextGen Office: ZIP archive with CCDA XML, CSV, binary files (images/PDFs), and HTML files. NextGen Direct Messaging: ZIP archive with CDA XML and binary files. Mirth Connect: XML messages with base64-encoded attachments.

documentation.notes: The PDF is a raw SQL Server schema dump: Table Name, Column Name, Data Type, Default, Not Null. No column descriptions, no value set enumerations, no relationship definitions. Only covers NextGen Enterprise EHR. The other three products (Office, Direct Messaging, Mirth Connect) have only brief prose descriptions on the landing page with no downloadable data dictionaries.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical tables: allergy tables (Allergy_Table_, patient_allergy, CARD_Allergies_), medication tables (Associate_Medications_, medication_list, patient_medication), diagnosis tables (CARD_DiagnosesAssessPlan_, Diagnostics_), vital signs tables (vital_signs_charts_, CARD_VitalSigns_), lab tables (CARD_Labs_, Graph_Lab_Results_, IORTS_ord_labs_), immunization tables (immunization_, immunizations, patient_immunization), problem lists, and hundreds of specialty-specific clinical templates (cardiology, ophthalmology, OB/GYN, orthopedics, behavioral health, dermatology, ENT, GI, urology, etc.). ~319 medication/allergy/lab/vital/diagnosis-related table names.

secure_messages.evidence: Tables: ngweb_communications, patient_email, patient_notifications, notification_queue, portal_document_posting_, portal_records_, Communication_summary_, FollowUp_Communication_, Prov_communication_, Provider_communication_, tis_pcp_communication_, erx_message_history, epcs_erx_message_history, intrf_message_log, rx_fill_message, patient_recall_message_result, patient_savings_message_history

billing_financial.evidence: Tables: charges, claims, claim_payers, transactions, NGWEB_STATEMENT_PAYMENT, TelephoneBilling_, procedure_billing_, procedure_billing_ext_, ext_charge_archive, ext_charge_holding_tank, ainf_feesheet_cpt_dx_, card_device_charges_, IORTS_surg_billing_, equip_rental_billing, bh_batch_charge_process_dt_, claim_based_reporting_, DCE_CCMBillingQueue_, sliding_fee_adjustment_log, practice_person_sliding_fee, nyhcra_surcharge_log, tis_charges_dtl_, sub_bh_billing_, tele_info_billing_

insurance_coverage.evidence: Tables: person_payer, person_payer_benefit_info, person_payer_fin_info, person_payer_package, person_payers_pat_pol_nbrs, encounter_payer, claim_payers, practice_payers_person, authorizations, bh_authorizations_, pat_auth, pat_auth_table, patient_eligibility, patient_eligiblty, rxh_eligibility, elig_ref_transactions, edr_preauthorizations, csc_case_payer, AINF_Payer_Override_Config_, CMSICDCoverage_, opk_vsp_auth_hist

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Tables: appointments, appointment_status_, appointment_diags, appointment_waitlist, ngweb_appointment_xref, info_missed_appointment_, missed_appointment_, missed_appointment_actions_, missed_appointment_hx_, patient_futur_appointment_, procedure_scheduling_, procedure_scheduling_data_, chm_scheduling_, schedule_surgery_, task_appointment_xref

documents_images.evidence: Tables: patient_documents, patient_images, patient_ics_images, patient_audio, Document_Library_, ImageCapture_, Image_Capture_, attachment_details_, order_attachment, referrals_attachments_, portal_document_posting_, hie_document, fax_result, audit_fax_print, gi_scope_images_, derm_image_body_, derm_image_face_. Landing page also states: 'While certain EHI, such as images, documents, reports, and audio files are referenced in the tables, they are located in the corresponding file folders in the extract.'

audit_trails.evidence: Tables: audit_, encounter_audit, delete_encounter_audit, ngweb_audit_log, ngweb_export_audit, account_access, opk_access, ext_api_access_data, Chart_Tracking_, info_chart_tracking_, info_patient_tracking_, template_audit, template_audit_casemgt, template_dur_audit, med_ndc_replace_audit, lab_critical_range_audit, incl_list_audit, PHI_Log_, prov_comm_audit_log_, contagionExposureDataAudit_, ob_problem_audit_log_, PGH_audit_log_ext_, info_audit_

downloaded_files.description: Complete EHI Data Dictionary for NextGen Enterprise EHR. 10,875 pages, 5,290 tables, ~281,893 columns. SQL Server schema: table name, column name, data type, default, not-null constraint. Dated June 27, 2025.
Landing page with EHI export documentation for all four products. Contains product-specific export format descriptions.
Derived file: all 5,290 unique table names extracted from the PDF via pdftotext.

issues: Only NextGen Enterprise EHR has a downloadable data dictionary. NextGen Office, Direct Messaging, and Mirth Connect have only brief prose descriptions of export formats with no schema documentation.
The data dictionary PDF has no column descriptions, definitions, or value set enumerations — just raw SQL Server schema metadata (column name, type, default, nullability).
No relationship/foreign key information is provided.
No sample export files or developer guides are available.
The obfuscated URL with noindex/nofollow makes the documentation effectively invisible to search engines.
The legal notice states the document may not be copied or reproduced without written consent, which conflicts with the ONC requirement for publicly accessible documentation.
summary: NextGen Healthcare provides an obfuscated but functional landing page covering four certified products. The primary documentation artifact is a massive 10,875-page PDF data dictionary for NextGen Enterprise EHR, documenting 5,290 SQL Server tables with ~281,893 columns. This is a genuine database schema dump reflecting a real EHR backend — not a curated FHIR resource list — with extensive specialty-specific clinical modules. However, it lacks column descriptions and value sets, and the other three products have no downloadable data dictionary at all, just brief prose descriptions of their export file formats (CCDA/CSV/XML).
